shadow-sm.description:
Utility for controlling the box shadow of an element

https://tailwindcss.com/docs/box-shadow

shadow.description:
Utility for controlling the box shadow of an element

https://tailwindcss.com/docs/box-shadow

shadow-lg.description:
Utility for controlling the box shadow of an element

https://tailwindcss.com/docs/box-shadow

shadow-2xl.description:
Use the shadow-inner utility to apply a subtle inset box shadow to an element. This can be useful for things like form controls or wells.

https://tailwindcss.com/docs/box-shadow#adding-an-inner-shadow

shadow-md.description:
Applying box-shadow filters to an element

https://tailwindcss.com/docs/box-shadow

popover.description: Background colour for popovers such as <DropdownMenu />, <HoverCard />, <Popover />

input.description: Border colour for inputs such as <Input />, <Select />, <Textarea />

accent.description: Accent colour for hover effects on <DropdownMenuItem>, <SelectItem>, etc.

destructive.description: Used for destructive actions such as <Button variant="destructive"> and <Toast variant="destructive">

ring.description: Ring colour used for focus state

hover:primary.description: Placeholder colour of the primary button background on hover (because there is no HSLA or RGBA support in variables now)

hover:secondary.description: Placeholder colour of the secondary button background on hover

border-destructive-50.description: Used for outlining destructive elements, such as buttons or alerts

bg-accent-50.description: Accent colour for hover effects on <DropdownMenuItem>, <SelectItem>, etc.

border-muted-40.description: Muted border like it Toast Buttons.

primary.description: Color for the buttons and accent elements in the sidebar

primary-foreground.description: Symbols color on the primary elements

accent.description: Accent surfaces, hover and other interactions

accent-foreground.description: Symbols on the accent surfaces in active state

max-w-xs.description: Utilities for setting the maximum width of an element.

max-w-7xl.description: Utilities for setting the maximum width of an element.

max-w-screen-sm.description: The max-w-screen-{breakpoint} classes can be used to give an element a max-width matching a specific breakpoint. These values are automatically derived from the theme.screens section of your tailwind.config.js file.

max-w-screen-md.description: The max-w-screen-{breakpoint} classes can be used to give an element a max-width matching a specific breakpoint. These values are automatically derived from the theme.screens section of your tailwind.config.js file.

max-w-screen-lg.description: The max-w-screen-{breakpoint} classes can be used to give an element a max-width matching a specific breakpoint. These values are automatically derived from the theme.screens section of your tailwind.config.js file.

max-w-screen-xl.description: The max-w-screen-{breakpoint} classes can be used to give an element a max-width matching a specific breakpoint. These values are automatically derived from the theme.screens section of your tailwind.config.js file.

max-w-screen-2xl.description: The max-w-screen-{breakpoint} classes can be used to give an element a max-width matching a specific breakpoint. These values are automatically derived from the theme.screens section of your tailwind.config.js file.
